text: [Music]
obiously just had an incredibly Vivid
proof of how intensely tied together uh
National economies are in this
globalized world of ours so now we find
even emerging economies that haven't
invested in subprime mortgages are
getting hammered and so clearly uh
globalization is not a thing that one
could talk about being for or against or
wishing to have more or less it it is
just it's the air we breathe it's the
fact of our life um and so the question
is how can this be used as a positive as
opposed to as a negative and I think
trade is a key example because when we
talk about needing to
help uh impoverished countries for
example you know we should give them
more Aid and so forth and I think if we
can use the aid wisely that's right but
in general those numbers are small
compared to the kind of Revenue that
these countries can be receiving in a
Freer trade system and so the failure of
of all the major uh trading nations of
the world to arrive at some regime and
what was called the Doha round some
regime of global free trade which would
have among other things produced
tremendous benefits for impoverished
countries hoping to penetrate the
markets of more developed countries
that's a disaster that's really a
disaster and it is fair to ask of Obama
who has been who is like any Democrat
needs to court unions and others who are
very skeptical about free trade it's
fair to ask of Obama whether he is
really going to commit himself to the
kind of uh global trading regime which
will bring real benefits to uh
impoverished Nations especially if it
means telling some American farmers we
can't keep giving you these subsidies
anymore
[Music]
